---

## GHQ 12 vs ITQ

GHQ 12 vs ITQ When it comes to psychology research, understanding and comparing the impacts of different questionnaires can be critical. 'GHQ 12 vs ITQ' is one such comparison. GHQ 12, or the 12-item General Health Questionnaire, is often used for detecting psychological distress, while the International Trauma Questionnaire (ITQ) is aimed at understanding trauma responses. Both tools serve important functions, but comparing them can be a complex process. That's where Harmony comes in. Harmony is an essential tool that uses AI and natural language processing to help researchers compare and harmonise data from these two tools – making 'GHQ 12 vs ITQ' an easier process. With Harmony, you can insert these questionnaires into the software, which will then use its algorithm to compare the item percentages of each tool. Harmony’s capacity to compare instruments in multiple languages further increases its usefulness. In conclusion, when it comes to comparison like 'GHQ 12 vs ITQ', Harmony can be an invaluable tool for psychologists and researchers. Its advanced features simplify the typically time-consuming task of harmonising diverse questionnaires, aiding in more efficient and accurate research. So, if you're a researcher grappling with 'GHQ 12 vs ITQ', give Harmony a try and experience the ease it brings to data harmonisation.
